page.title: 11Mill Hall
page.content: The house bears the date 1503 on the end wall. Half timbered and plastered, it is entered by a wooden porch with 18th C balusters at the sides. The hallway is small with a staircase of late 17th C and a large fireplace. Above this are the Royal arms encircled by the Garter and flanked by the initals "ER". Queen Elizabeth I is thought to have stayed here in 1534. Her room has original lead paned windows and moulded oak panelling. The ceiling bears royal designs in the plaster, fleur de lis, crowns, feathers and acorns. There are many oak beams in the house with curious, holes and notches in them. They were once ships' beams. Originally the home of John Porter, it is now owned by Mr and Mrs Wootten.
